About Me

Flying Sheep Logo

Client: Flying Sheep
Role: Logo Design
Year: 2013

Flying Sheep is a group of amateur filmmakers from Bolzano, Italy. The name comes from a Monty Python sketch from 1969, part of the television series ”Monty Python’s Flying Circus”. The group needed a simple logo illustration, but they were not sure what kind of style they wanted, so they left that to me.

From the beginning, I wanted the logo to reflect the Monty Python sketch: Funny, playful, kind of odd and, importantly, retro-looking. I explored different directions, but eventually settled with the idea of the sheep with balloons and a flat, simple visual style with a 70s-style color palette. The custom typeface designed to look like handwriting, along with the uneven forms of the illustration gives the logo a custom, hand-made look.

Also, this:

"Why don't you just get rid of Harold?"
"Because of the enormous commercial possibilities should he succeed."
